actions.text: Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 2989. The resolution waives points of order against provisions of the bill for failure to comply with the provisions of clause 2 of rule XXI, and clause 5(b) of rule XXI. In any case where this resolution waives points of order against only a portion of a paragraph, a point of of order against any other provision in such paragraph may be made only against such provision and not against the entire paragraph. Measure will be read by section. Bill is open to amendments.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 101-191, by Ms. Slaughter (NY).
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 42.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Waiving certain points of order against consideration of the bill (H.R. 2989) making appropriations for the Treasury Department, the United States Postal Service, the Executive Office of the President, and certain Independent Agencies, for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1990, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Waives points of order against the consideration of H.R. 2989 (appropriations).

titles.title: Waiving certain points of order against consideration of the bill (H.R. 2989) making appropriations for the Treasury Department, the United States Postal Service, the Executive Office of the President, and certain Independent Agencies, for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1990, and for other purposes.
